Organization: IFC - International Finance Corporation Country: Singapore City: Singapore Office: IFC in Singapore Follow @UNjobs Investment Analyst Job #: req15215 Organization: IFC Sector: Investment Grade: GE Term Duration: 2 years 0 months Recruitment Type: Local Recruitment Location: Singapore Required Language(s): English Preferred Language(s): Closing Date: 3/3/2022 (MM/DD/YYYY) at 11:59pm UTC Description IFC�a member of the World Bank Group�is the largest global development institution focused on the private sector in emerging markets. We work in more than 100 countries, using our capital, expertise, and influence to create markets and opportunities in developing countries. In fiscal year 2021, IFC committed a record $31.5 billion to private companies and financial institutions in developing countries, leveraging the power of the private sector to end extreme poverty and boost shared prosperity as economies grapple with the impacts of the COVID-19 pandemic. For more information, visit www.ifc.org The Manufacturing, Agribusiness & Services (MAS) Industry Group plays an important role in supporting IFC's strategic priorities, covering investments in the global manufacturing and services, agribusiness, health and education sectors. MAS' sectors play a critical role in providing goods and services to consumers; addressing core needs, creating jobs, contributing to government revenue and stimulating growth. In IFC's client countries, these sectors can account for as much as 80% of overall economic activity and can account for up to 90% of employment activity, particularly in the poorest countries. MAS is looking for an Investment Analyst to be based in Singapore to support the sector teams in the Asia and the Pacific region. Investment Analysts work closely with IFC's Investment Officers, who are responsible for sourcing, negotiation, appraisal, structuring, and subsequent supervision of IFC's investment projects. Duties and Accountabilities: Compile, ensure integrity and quality of, and analyze qualitative and quantitative data for new investments and portfolios. Prepare portfolio reports and generate needed data from multiple sources. . Draft memos and process waivers, amendments, and ESAMs based on guidance from a more senior investment officer. Perform analytical work (due diligence, financial modeling, preparation of pricing comparability data) as input to support designing and restructuring options of investment projects Gather and summarize information on sectors and countries. Look at prior transactions and track records with specific clients to develop input to future business possibilities. Perform credit and integrity risk rating assessments, covenant compliance reviews (debt), and valuations (equity), and monitor changes to risk flags. Gather and analyze data to support assessment of project development impact. Perform ad hoc tasks when needed. Selection Criteria c78ef43 7FHV8 Bachelor's degree in a related field and at least of 2-3 years of relevant experience. Related fields of education include business, finance, or economics or an area of expertise specific to a sector, subject matter, or industry specialty. Relevant experience could include a proven track record in business, consulting, banking or investment. Goodunderstanding of how specific investments transactions in different industries and sectors impact economic, market, and social development, and how to use mapping methodology to assess market conditions, gaps, and business opportunities. Demonstrate communication skills to identify client and stakeholder needs. Demonstrate diplomacy and responsiveness in interactions with others. Able to form relationships with counterparts and mid-level clients and stakeholders to exchange information needed for transaction or portfolio processing. Write in a logical and comprehensive, yet concise manner. Distill and summarize large amounts of information from various sources to prepare business documents and presentations. Ability to conduct market and industry research and analysis. Demonstrated skill in financial statement analysis, accounting, finance, financial modeling, DCF, and comparable company analysis to support informed decision making. Ability to demonstrate attention to detail, thoughtful scenario analysis, and diligence in the quality of one's own work. Fully understands the financial aspects of investment transactions, including how to conduct market analysis and determine financial soundness of company or project opportunity. Fluent in written and spoken English. World Bank Group Core Competencies The World Bank Group offers comprehensive benefits, including a retirement plan; medical, life and disability insurance; and paid leave, including parental leave, as well as reasonable accommodations for individuals with disabilities. We are proud to be an equal opportunity and inclusive employer with a dedicated and committed workforce, and do not discriminate based on gender, gender identity, religion, race, ethnicity, sexual orientation, or disability. Learn more about working at the World Bank and IFC, including our values and inspiring stories.

Job_Title: Senior Expert Strategy Workforce Planning (within APAC)
Job_Descriptions: A career at our company is an ongoing journey of discovery: our 58,000 people are shaping how the world lives, works and plays through next generation advancements in Healthcare, Life Science and Electronics. For more than 350 years and across the world we have passionately pursued our curiosity to find novel and vibrant ways of enhancing the lives of others. Your role: We are offering an exciting opportunity as Senior Expert Strategic Workforce Planning (SWP) in our Innovation HR Talent organization. Within a global team of experts, you will play a key role in shaping and implementing our SWP solutions aimed at consulting and supporting Sector HR and Senior Leaders to define mid and long-term workforce critical capabilities and roles requirements to deliver on strategic business and people plans. You will drive and contribute to the deployment of SWP enablement approaches and tools across sectors, for Sector HR to lead and deliver SWP initiatives to shape the future success of our company. As Global Solution Owner you will contribute to the global governance, continuous improvement and enablement activities related to our Global SWP solution to ensure quality and business impact. This also includes to partner with external vendors for gaining an out-side-in data perspective and trend benchmarking insights. You shape our copmany's future by making sure we are set-up with the future-critical capabilities needed. Besides SWP, be a key driver in establishing a concept for Skill Management along our employee lifecycle solutions and supporting this exciting journey towards an ‘E2E Skill Ecosystem’. Who you are: Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in a relevant (HR) field 4-6+ years of relevant work experience with a passion for people-related topics Strong ability to translate concrete business requirements into tangible HR solutions Strong project management, analytical thinking and detail orientation Strong stakeholder management skills and a commitment to collaborate Strong global mindset and intercultural competencies Fluency in English, any additional language would be a plus (e.g. German) The position is open to be taken on within APAC Region. What we offer:  With us, there are always opportunities to break new ground. We empower you to fulfil your ambitions, and our diverse businesses offer various career moves to seek new horizons. We trust you with responsibility early on and support you to draw your own career map that is responsive to your aspirations and priorities in life. Join us and bring your curiosity to life!

Job_Title: Head of Product Control – Leading Commodities Multinational (Dry bulk and hard)
Job_Descriptions: Leading dry bulk and hard commodities group Track record in transformation Leadership position This is a leading commodity trading MNC with expansion plans for Asia Pacific, trading mainly in dry bulk and hard commodities. Due to ambitious transformation plans, they are on the search for a high calibre Head of Product Control with a track record in business process re-engineering. Reporting to the Chief Risk Officer, the Head of Product Control will play in a key role in performing daily reporting of P&L for the Asian desks, including business analysis and commentaries on the P&L drivers. He/ She will partake in active discussions with front office and risk around trading strategy, trading positions and business process improvement initiatives. He/ She will also be the key controls interface with the traders and related functions including execution, middle office, and operations. The successful candidate must possess a degree in a finance discipline, with a minimum of 15 years’ work experience, with the recent years in a team management capacity with a physical commodities trading company. Qualifications including CA/ ACCA will be viewed upon favourably. You will also have a good knowledge and understanding of the trading markets and instruments, along with track record of transformation and business process improvement initiatives. To apply, please submit your resume to Ailing Huang at **@kerryconsulting.com, quoting the job title and reference number AH22261. Only successful shortlisted candidates will be notified. Licence No: 16S8060 Registration no: R1104181

Job_Title: ETRM Risk Advisor (2 year contract) – Large Energy Trading Company
Job_Descriptions: Part of risk function System design and implementation and process changes, Risk control function consultation 10-15 years’ experience This is a large energy conglomerate with a significant part of its business focused on energy trading. As part of the Group’s growth agenda and demands for high quality trading content and information, the trading group is on the search for an ETRM Risk Advisor to embark on the project for a 2 year term. Reporting to the Head of Risk, the Advisor will be the internal consultant, representing the needs of risk and middle office to oversee system design, implementation and process change. Discussing and collecting the user requirements from these functions, the ETRM Advisor will propose the system design, thereafter streamlining the process relating to trading, risk control. About Oliver Wyman Oliver Wyman is a global leader in management consulting. With offices in 60 cities across 29 countries, Oliver Wyman combines deep industry knowledge with specialized expertise in strategy, operations, risk management, and organization transformation. Our 5000 professionals help clients optimize their business, improve their operations and risk profile, and accelerate their organizational performance to seize the most attractive opportunities. Oliver Wyman’s thought leadership is evident in our agenda-setting books, white papers, research reports, and articles in the business press.  Our clients are the CEOs and executive teams of the top Global 1000 companies. Visit our website for more details about Oliver Wyman: www.oliverwyman.com Job specification Job title: Engagement Manager Department: Finance & Risk Office/region: Singapore Reports to: Partner Hours: Normal Business Hours Job Overview: The Finance and Risk practice, part of our Financial Services Group, is seeking an Engagement Manager to support our continued expansion, a strategic priority for the firm. This is an exciting opportunity to be part of a successful team that represents a core competency of the firm. Oliver Wyman’s Finance and Risk practice is the world’s top strategic risk management consultancy, and is engaged to solve the most challenging problems at the largest and most complex global financial institutions. Furthermore, Oliver Wyman is also looking at the implications of digital on finance and risk management. The Finance and Risk practice advises clients in the financial services sector to adapt their finance and risk management strategies to evolving supervisory expectations, competition within the banking sector and capital markets dynamics.  Our projects focus on issues at the top of the C-suite (in particular CFO, CRO) and Board agendas, and span a wide spectrum of issues and solutions. Our recent projects have covered topics including: Stress Testing strategy diagnostic Fundamental review of the trading book Asset / liability, interest rate risk, and liquidity risk management Risk-appetite driven pricing and performance measurement strategies Analytical modeling with a focus on development and validation of financial and non-financial risk models, portfolio/instrument level valuation models and strategic planning and forecasting models Strategic financial resource management initiatives (e.g. balance sheet management, RWA optimization) Recovery and resolution planning For more information about our Practice, please visit: http://www.oliverwyman.com/our-expertise/industries/financial-services/finance-and-risk.html Key Responsibilities: Engagement Managers direct the day-to-day work of our consulting teams, working side-by-side with our clients. The Engagement Manager position offers excellent career and growth opportunities for talented, highly motivated professionals with notable prior experience. Engagement Managers are given the opportunity for rapid professional growth, to participate in entrepreneurial work, and to share in the success of the team. Initial responsibilities may include: Leading teams of consultants in complex analysis and strategic problem solving including: problem framing, the use of advanced analytical techniques, results synthesis, and identification of client implications Overseeing and guiding the consulting team as they develop hypotheses; manage data collection, model creation and analyses; conduct primary and secondary research; creatively tackle information limitations; and surface insights Supporting Partners in project execution through excellent project management including: work planning, managing work flow, upward management and coaching/developing more junior team members Managing client relationships and networks, presenting to senior audiences, and working day-to-day with senior and mid-level clients Effectively communicating issues and solutions in formal and informal settings, through written and verbal communication Experience Required: Just as every client project is different, we recognize and value the diversity of backgrounds and skill sets for successful Engagement Manager candidates.  We are seeking high-caliber individuals who want to join our winning team.  Preference will be given to candidates with: 5+ years of relevant experience, ideally with a top-tier strategy consulting firm (or other similar organizations with project-based, team-oriented environments) In-depth knowledge of topics in Finance and Risk gained through experience in the industry or in other Top Tier consultancy houses, prior experience with finance, risk, treasury and strategic planning related topics. Skills and Attributes: Track record of leading and managing teams, and delivering against tight deadlines in fast-paced, demanding environments Strong background in strategic problem solving with demonstrable analytical skills Outstanding written and verbal communication skills Undergraduate or advanced degree from a top academic program Willingness to travel Fluency in English

Facilities Technician - Life Science Integrated Facilities Management – Work Dynamics (Singapore) What this job involves: Assisting in the day-to-day operations You will be assisting the immediate superior in the day-to-day operations of the site. This includes undertaking any duties assigned by the Management or the Immediate Superior. You will be managing all electrical and mechanical works in the premises and attend to client’s requests on electrical matters. You will also be attending to owner’s complaints of the common areas as well as manage and record the technical inventory. Being responsible You will be conducting daily checks on essential equipment to ensure that they are operating in a satisfactory condition at all times. This also includes carrying out meter readings on operating equipment for energy consumption. You will also conduct regular inspections with term contractors (e.g. waste treatment, pest control, fire protection systems, lift and water treatment) to ensure that the services are carried out in accordance to the standards set by OMS/ Management. We want to ensure that the clients are provided with high standards of service at all times. Being responsible also means that you will operate/ maintain all equipment within the premises to ensure all equipment are in working condition – equipment could include low tension switchgears, air-conditioning equipment, plumbing and compressor. Assisting the Facilities Manager You will be assisting the Facilities Manager in the supervision of appointed term contracts (e.g. cleaning, pest control, etc.). You will also assist the Facilities Manager in the progressive take-over of common areas, take-over of O&M/ as-built drawings, equipment, lighting operational timing period and tabulation, common inventory, etc. When there are potential issues, you will assist in collating common areas’ observation and report to the immediate superior. Execution of daily routine facilities and maintenance work. Maintaining all site facilities in best conditions and within the framework of Good Manufacturing Practice (GMP) & EHS requirement. Takes personal responsibility for quality and details in all aspects of facility maintenance work that have impact on safety and product quality. Planning and coordinating vendor site servicing activities. Executing and closing of Work Orders as per schedule. Able to perform troubleshooting of general building M&E equipment and rectification on basic building defects. Perform regular building inspections to report/feedback on building defects. Coordinate rectification works for the defects. Familiar with instrument calibration program Execute/coordinate rectification works to enable smooth work handover and minimize disruption to production/client operations schedule Ensure cost effectiveness of all maintenance jobs. Ensure quality standard in all aspects of facility services work that will have impact on product quality. Takes personal responsibility for quality in all aspects of facility services work that will have impact on product quality. Sound like you? To apply you need to be: Knowledgeable and experienced You have at least a Higher NITEC/NITEC in Electrical/ Mechanical Engineering or equivalent with 2 to 4 years of relevant experience in handling building. It would be an advantage for you if you have LEW Grade 7. We will empower your ambitions through our dedicated Total Rewards Program, competitive pay and benefits package. Apply today! Facilities Coordinator - Life Science Integrated Facilities Management – Work Dynamics (Singapore) What this job involves: Providing onsite support You will be the upper facilities management’s trusted right hand on all facilities-related activities. You’ll do this by performing routine site inspections to ensure all building processes and best practices are implemented and maintained. Where can processes be improved?  How can we save costs?  These are questions that will be at the forefront of the team’s thinking.  You, too, will always have an eye on this, contributing suggestions as they arise. You’ll also lend the team a big hand by providing admin support including front desk duties, basic housekeeping and appointment coordination.  Also part of your job scope is to hit key performance indicators and meet service level agreements. Meeting the clients’ facilities needs At JLL, we put client satisfaction at the front and centre of everything we do. If you share our values, we will be more than happy to work with you. In this role, you’ll be responsible for working closely with clients and suppliers onsite to identify their facility-related enquiries and requirements. Your planning and budgeting skills will also be vital to the job, as you’ll take part in the procurement of vendors and services from time to time. Making everyone safe and risk-free Do you value workplace safety? If so, you’ll be a perfect fit for the job. In this role, you will ensure everyone’s health and safety by keeping safe workplace procedures in place and order. You’ll also be expected to carry out these procedures, as needed. At the same time, this role puts you on the first line of defence against risks. As such, you will help implement and manage risk management programs, disaster recovery and business continuity plans. You’ll also be expected to follow escalation and incident reporting procedures, and comply with the firm’s guidelines and strategies. Sound like you? To apply, you need to be a: Passion for service Do you have a prior experience in facilities, property management, hospitality or other related fields? Do you have an understanding of local occupational health and safety requirements, critical facilities and vendor management? Are you knowledgeable in various property systems? You are what we’re looking for! Team player JLL’s unmatched excellence is only made possible by team work—a core value we want you to possess. As the facilities coordinator, we expect you to support the team and work well with others toward achieving targets. Likewise, you must have a proven track record of flawless project execution, all while following company standards and procedures. Are you at your most vibrant when you’ve successfully distilled data into its simplest, most meaningful form? Thoughtworks is a global software consultancy with an aim to create a positive impact on the world through technology. Our community of technologists thinks disruptively to deliver pragmatic solutions for our clients' most complex challenges. We are curious minds who come together as collaborative and inclusive teams to push boundaries, free to be ourselves and make our mark in tech. As consultants, we work with our clients to ensure we’re evolving their technology and empowering adaptive mindsets to meet their business goals. You could influence the digital strategy of a retail giant, build a bold new mobile application for a bank or redesign platforms using event sourcing and intelligent data pipelines. You will learn to use the latest Lean and Agile thinking, create pragmatic solutions to solve mission-critical problems and challenge yourself every day. Data Engineers develop modern data architecture approaches to meet key business objectives and provide end-to-end data solutions. You might spend a few weeks with a new client on a deep technical review or a complete organizational review, helping them to understand the potential that data brings to solve their most pressing problems. On other projects, you might be acting as the architect, leading the design of technical solutions, or perhaps overseeing a program inception to build a new product. It could also be a software delivery project where you're equally happy coding and tech-leading the team to implement the solution. Expectations for Success We are looking for a motivated quantitative market research professional who is interested in growing within an awesome cross-functional team of Research Experts. In this role, we need you to be naturally curious and have a passion for understanding human behaviour.  A high level of motivation and excellent communication skills are required to manage an incredibly diverse slate of work, clients, and internal stakeholders. This role provides an opportunity to work across a diverse portfolio of clients doing both ad hoc and continuous research projects. The role requires the skill set and expertise of a skilled market research practitioner with experience in developing questionnaires and managing projects in-field. The successful candidate will also be able to effectively analyse and interrogate data and develop analysis plans with a strategic mindset and an understanding of how to develop actionable and commercially relevant insights. About the Team The team is all about hitting numbers, breaking records and having fun while we do it. Our company is relatively young in age but are far above our years in taking on responsibilities and making a name for ourselves. Come join us for the ride of your life. A Day in the Life Key responsibilities can be broad and diverse. You need to be able to (with support and guidance), effectively manage the following: Participate fully in project kick-off meetings to understand project purpose and goals Contribute and provide support with questionnaire development, writing questions that use clear phrasing and uphold Qualtrics and industry best practices. Building surveys on the Qualtrics platform Test survey links (including testing for spelling, grammar, and logic skips). Handle project logistics, including maintaining organisation and timelines among the internal team, scheduling and planning research engagements, checking data (with the ability and desire to learn how to manage both “up” and “down”). Be able to effectively problem solve logistical issues and adjust on the fly.  Proactively identify issues and suggest solutions on how to make projects run more smoothly. The role also requires supporting report/ dashboard creation (with the assistance of Research Consultants and Managers), including writing, analysis, chart and table creation in Excel or PowerPoint. As you grow in the position, you can look forward to more client contact, an increased role in business development and proposal writing/methodology creation. Minimum Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree in a relevant discipline (e.g. Commerce, Psychology, Mathematics/Statistics) with strong academic achievement. Minimum 1 year of agency-side or client-side market research experience (ideally 2-3 years). Demonstrated ability in delivering end to end research projects. Excellent writing and communication skills. Highly proficient in MS Office suite (PowerPoint, Excel, Word). Highly proficient in the use of statistical analysis software (ideally SPSS). Preferred Qualifications: Masters or honors degree in a relevant discipline (e.g. Commerce, Psychology, Mathematics/Statistics) What differentiates us from other companies Work life integration is deeply important to us - we have frequent office events, team outings, and happy hours. We take pride in our office design aiming at cultivating creativity from our rooftop views to an open and collaborative work space. On top of standard benefits package (medical, dental, vision, life insurance, etc) we provide snacks, drinks, and free lunches in our office. We believe in sharing Qualtrics success which is part of the compensation for all employees.

Lifeguard Job Responsibilities: Supervises swimming activities at the aquatics facility and ensures that policies, guidelines, and safety procedures are followed. Supervises and assists in cleaning the pool and related facilities and equipment, assists with chlorine residual water tests and with records and charts of water tests and records of accidents, and adds chemicals to pool water as directed. Resolves scheduling conflicts to ensure safe pool environment when competing programs/priorities require use of aquatic facilities. Would you like to be part of the most international company in the world? A company operating in more than 220 countries worldwide, and has been pioneering cross-border express shipping since 1969. Would you like to be part of a business that connects people across the globe? And the more we connect, the better life on Earth becomes. Do you want to make a difference? If you have answered Yes! to the above, join our Insanely Customer-Centric team now! For more information on DHL Express, please visit workingatdhl.com. DHL Express Global Head Office has an opening for Technical Director in the Customer Facing IT Domain. The key purpose of this role is: Responsible for high-quality design, delivery, and ownership of key platforms like Contact Centre as a Service (CCaaS). Build a multi-year strategy for a cloud strategy that will scale and optimize the IT stack in parallel with the hyper-growth of the organization. Act as a trusted advisor to other parts of IT organization and business leadership, work closely together to launch new programs and initiatives based on organization priorities. Provide multi-technology consulting services to internal IT and business functions to analyze and provide strategies and solutions on all aspects of Contact Centre application software, Cloud, infrastructure and related technology components. Ensure the interoperability of technologies within the strategic IT programs along with the development of Enterprise Architecture practices, governance and design patterns. Facilitate the development and commercial effectiveness of IT services, through management of the optimization of technology and service constructs. Ensure the integrity of the production IT services through expert knowledge-based advice on technology solution development, and governance of change into the technology environment. Take responsibility and participate in the integration of the roadmap solution by devising the internal co-ordination of the solution implementation. Own the architectural design for Contact Centre as a Service (CCaaS) platform that will enable achievement of business strategy and organization objectives. Manage or coordinate between several applications/products/services as part of the customer-facing applications, including build and run elements to support optimum functioning of the business functions. Provide product and project oversight to ensure that project is delivered to agreed scope, time, cost, quality, governance and satisfaction, as per agreed roadmaps. Provide technical oversight to ensure that changes are in line with architecture and are developed with highest quality standards for customer experience, performance and availability. The best-fit candidate may be based in Europe, India (Chennai), Malaysia (KUL or CBJ) or Singapore. YOUR TASKS Develop and hire the team - managing a global department, including career development/coaching, expectations setting, bi-annual performance reviews, resource planning, and department growth including hiring Seek to understand how people, processes, and technology interact to perform the fundamental activities of the business in both current and future states and model these interactions to guide technology strategy in order to better achieve the strategic goals and objectives of the business. Work cross-functionally to understand the linkage between DHL Express' business goals, business architectures, and technology architectures - and strive to further DHL Express’ business goals via organic or inorganic evolution of reference architectures. Own the long-term vision for the enterprise architecture; desired technology processes and systems and system integration. Support development of 3 to 5 year roadmaps for technology domains and services that articulate DHL Express' evolution based on strategic and architectural analysis Lead the implementation of current and future state roadmap; partner cross-functionally to design. Facilitate the integration framework and multi-cloud application integration architecture and implementation. Provide thought leadership and direction in architecting Contact Centre applications and define an enterprise-wide integrations vision and plan with functional support ensuring that technical decisions support DHL Express’ quality, performance, scalability, reliability, availability, and security goals. Apply a structured business architecture approach and methodology for capturing the key views of the business units in the context of the enterprise. Capture the tactical and strategic business goals that provide traceability through the organization and are mapped to metrics that provide ongoing governance. Enumerate, analyze, catalog, and suggest improvements to the organization’s strategic, core and support processes, as needed, to support strategic and operational goals. Enumerate, analyze, and suggest improvements to the structural relationships of the business. This requires the creation and maintenance of an ongoing model of roles and capabilities, and the interplay between organization’s business units in various business processes, materials, people, and systems. Support the governance process required to ensure the continued integrity of company data. Work with business functions to understand needs, priorities and issues to plan the associated IT roadmaps. Provide consultancy and support business on the customer facing web application development to improve overall customer experience through digitalization. To drive techno-functional discussion in Omni Channel space enterprise wide. Accountable that projects are delivered to agreed time, cost, quality, governance and satisfaction. Ownership and resolution of issues reported on systems in production to ensure minimum business disruption. Manage external/internal IT resources engaged during the execution of a project. Work directly with DHL customers, suppliers or internal staff (at global/regional/functional levels). Participate in global project teams based on role and involvement. Act as Global Business IT lead for global projects with full responsibility on the delivery side of the IT component. WHAT WE NEED FROM YOU Minimum 15 years of multi-disciplined IT experience and IT solutions development and implementation experience: Proven track record for managing and delivering complex IT solutions. Significant demonstrable skills in a wide variety of IT Services, Software, Applications Cloud Services, Networking, Datacenter Communications (including Contact Centre), Security, End-User Computing and Digital Business Solutions. Proven experience integrating the solution for the project with the business domain, enterprise concerns, industry standards, established patterns, and best practices. Strong knowledge of global voice and GDPR regulatory and data sovereignty requirements. Proven experience in managing enterprise license frame and budget. In-depth knowledge and hands-on experience with Enterprise Architecture strategy and roadmap development utilizing standard framework and methodologies such as TOGAF or Zachman. Proven IT operations experience with good understanding of ITIL processes. Direct experience in architecting and implementing large scale and complex IT projects involving multiple technologies for on-premises, Public Cloud, Hybrid Cloud and multi-cloud. Strong understanding of relational data structures, theories, principles, and practices. Demonstrated expertise with financial/logistics services application environment, and data / information system life cycle methodologies. Experience with business requirements analysis, entity relationship planning, reporting structures, and Master Data Management. Strong understanding and experience of Web services, SOA (Service Oriented Architecture), and EAI (Enterprise Application Integration). Demonstrated track record of devising technology plan aligned with business program and effective implementations. Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal. Ability to develop multiple, global initiatives autonomously. Get-it-done attitude: Capable to break through organizational silos; Manage and achieve goals in a matrix environment; Quick to adopt best practice rather than re-invent the wheel. Flexibility in operating style and attitude. Diplomatic, tactful, patient and sensitive to cultural differences. Positive and contributory attitude, total dedication to customer’s needs. Highly customer oriented. Global experience, collaboration and teaming. Self-motivated and ability to team with, and manage, a strong partner/supplier system. Resilient, capable of recovering quickly from setbacks. Maintains performance under pressure. Respect and Result focused behavior. University Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Business Administration or related field or similar experience/education. Desirable if you have Professional Certification in at least one relevant Project Management Technique (Prince2 or PMI) and IT Service Management Technique (i.e., ITIL). Do you see a personal challenge in these versatile and responsible tasks? Apply now - we look forward to receiving your application! CONNECTING PEOPLE. Morgan Stanley is a leading global financial services firm providing investment banking, securities, investment management and wealth management services. With offices in more than 43 countries, the Firm's employees serve clients worldwide including corporations, governments, institutions and individuals. Within Morgan Stanley, Credit Risk Management (CRM) evaluates credit risk transactions, especially loans and derivatives, from all Business Units within the bank. The department also assigns Internal Credit Ratings; establishes and manages credit risk limits in accordance with the risk tolerance established by the Board; monitors and reports on credit risk exposures on a regular basis to the Chief Risk Officer and senior management. CRM also interacts with business units to ensure that credit risk assessments are factored into business decisions. Based in Singapore, the Asia (including Japan) Credit Risk Department is currently seeking a high-performing and hands-on credit risk professional at the Associate level in the Counterparty Credit Risk team with a focus on hedge fund counterparties. The role will have the following key responsibilities: - Perform credit analysis of hedge funds (through review client materials and due diligence calls/meetings) to establish ratings and risk appetite - Approve credit limits and transactions up to level of delegated credit authority. Review and recommend for approval other limits and credit risk-related transactions - Have a thorough understanding of the products traded by hedge fund clients - Establish a thorough understanding of the portfolio data and prepare appropriate reporting and escalation - Present views to regional and global risk teams - Build strong relationships with first line risk management partners - Build strong relationships with global counterparty credit risk peers to ensure regional consistency and promote regional priorities - Maintain an up-to-date view of the regional hedge fund industry and develop sovereign and macro risk views as need to support decision making - Review new clients and propose documentation terms (ISDA/CSA, Prime Brokerage agreements, GMRAs, etc) which ensure strong credit term protection Requirements - Bachelor’s degree preferably in Finance or Economics or a quantitative subject - At least 3 years of experience in the financial services industry (and at least 2 years in risk management, preferably within a hedge fund or financial institutions credit coverage role) - Good understanding of equity markets, derivative transactions, and margining processes - Highly numerate with strong data skills (particularly SQL); some programming experience a plus - Excellent communication skills and ability to build network with counterparts in London and NY as well as with business stakeholders - Ability to work independently on multiple ongoing projects; curiosity to learn in a fast-paced environment and willingness to excel and go beyond expectation Salary offered will commensurate with the experience of the candidate.

Morgan Stanley is a leading global financial services firm providing investment banking, securities, investment management and wealth management services. With offices in more than 43 countries, the Firm’s employees serve clients worldwide including corporations, governments, institutions and individuals. Within Morgan Stanley, Credit Risk Management (CRM) evaluates credit risk transactions, especially loans and derivatives, from all BUs within the Firm. The department also assigns Internal Credit Ratings; establishes and manages credit risk limits in accordance with the risk tolerance established by the Board; monitors and reports on credit risk exposures on a regular basis to the Chief Risk Officer and senior management. CRM also interacts with business units to ensure that credit risk assessments are factored into business decisions. Based in Singapore, the Asia (incl Japan) Credit Risk Department is currently seeking a high-performing and hands-on credit risk professional with experience covering Corporates in Asia. This role will have these key responsibilities: • Perform necessary credit due diligence and analysis on borrowers and trading counterparties to the Firm • Review and recommend for approval credit risk-related transactions • Approve transactions / credit limits up to level of delegated credit authority • Conduct industry research and develop sovereign and macro risk views as need to support decision making • Conduct client calls, perform independent research and establish credit rating of counterparties • Prepare loan and annual review memos for active/potential counterparties with credit limits • Review loan / derivative documentation with counterparties to ensure strong credit term protection • Monitor portfolio quality on an ongoing basis and recommend rating actions / asset classifications etc. Requirements: • Bachelor’s degree preferably in Business Administration, Finance or Economics • At least 3 years of credit analysis experience in the financial services industry • Sound credit research skills • Good team player with strong initiative and appetite to learn in a fast-paced environment • Mandarin skills, while not essential, will be beneficial · Junior candidates will be considered for Analyst role Salary offered will commensurate with the experience of the candidate.

About Us Digitalisation is more than technology. We deliver apps in days instead of months, for a fraction of the usual upfront costs and zero on-going, for a share of the success. The pandemic has made our services more relevant than ever. We are building a new team to support our partners to help them thrive, transform and grow in the new normal and grow our ecosystem. Morgan Stanley is a leading global financial services firm providing investment banking, securities, investment management and wealth management services. With offices in more than 43 countries, the Firm's employees serve clients worldwide including corporations, governments, institutions and individuals. Within Morgan Stanley, Credit Risk Management (CRM) evaluates credit risk transactions, especially loans and derivatives, from all Business Units within the bank. The department also assigns Internal Credit Ratings; establishes and manages credit risk limits in accordance with the risk tolerance established by the Board; monitors and reports on credit risk exposures on a regular basis to the Chief Risk Officer and senior management. CRM also interacts with business units to ensure that credit risk assessments are factored into business decisions. Based in Singapore, the Asia (including Japan) Credit Risk Department is currently seeking a high-performing and hands-on credit risk professional at the Associate level in the Counterparty Credit Risk team with a focus on hedge fund counterparties. Job_Title: Credit Risk – Credit Portfolio, Analytics & Reporting, Analyst
Job_Descriptions: Morgan Stanley is a leading global financial services firm providing investment banking, securities, investment management and wealth management services. With offices in more than 43 countries, the Firm’s employees serve clients worldwide including corporations, governments, institutions and individuals. Within Morgan Stanley, Credit Risk Management (CRM) evaluates credit risk transactions, especially loans and derivatives, from all Business Units within the Firm. The department also assigns Internal Credit Ratings; establishes and manages credit risk limits in accordance with the risk tolerance established by the Board; monitors and reports on credit risk exposures on a regular basis to the Chief Risk Officer and senior management. CRM also interacts with business units to ensure that credit risk assessments are factored into business decisions. Based in Singapore, the Asia (incl Japan) Credit Risk Department is currently seeking a hands-on professional covering credit portfolio management and reporting duties which support CRM senior management. Key responsibilities Assist credit risk managers in managing a complex credit exposure portfolio across Pan Asia by: Providing analytical support for complex derivative products across institutional and wealth management platforms Understand and take ownership of the various stress testing processes in the region Support legal entity credit risk managers with capital planning projects Assist in creating and managing high quality credit reporting at holistic and specific business units for senior management and regulatory purposes Liaise with global credit and risk team members on tasks involving credit portfolio management, stress testing, data quality management, credit reporting and other ad hoc tasks Requirements Degree holder with quantitative / statistics skills in a finance related subject Sound knowledge / modeling skills in derivative products across fixed income, equities, FX, and commodities Good understanding of inputs, assumptions, parameter calibration, and output related to credit portfolio risk models, as well as stress testing models commodities Strong analytical and problem-solving skills Enthusiastic, self-motivated, flexible and desire to learn and develop Exceptional skills in Excel, PowerPoint Good to have: Good understanding of Pan Asia markets with a holistic view across different risk domains Programming knowledge (e.g. Excel VBA/ SQL) Salary offered will commensurate with the experience of the candidate.

Job_Title: Credit Risk - Country Risk & FIs, Vice President
Job_Descriptions: Morgan Stanley is a leading global financial services firm providing investment banking, securities, investment management and wealth management services. With offices in more than 43 countries, the Firm’s employees serve clients worldwide including corporations, governments, institutions and individuals. Within Morgan Stanley, Credit Risk Management (CRM) evaluates credit risk transactions, especially loans and derivatives, from all Business Units within the Firm. The department also assigns Internal Credit Ratings; establishes and manages credit risk limits in accordance with the risk tolerance established by the Board; monitors and reports on credit risk exposures on a regular basis to the Chief Risk Officer and senior management. CRM also interacts with business units to ensure that credit risk assessments are factored into business decisions. Based in Singapore, the Asia (incl Japan) Credit Risk Department is currently seeking a high-performing and hands-on credit risk professional at the VP level in the Counterparty Credit Risk team covering a combination of Country Risk and Financial Institutions. The role will have the following key responsibilities: • Perform necessary credit due diligence and analysis on trading counterparties and borrowers of the Firm • Review and recommend risk appetite for country risk purposes • Approve transactions / credit limits up to level of delegated credit authority • Develop sovereign and macro risk views for senior management discussions • Conduct client calls, perform independent research and establish credit rating of counterparties · Make presentation to regional and other risk teams on sector reviews and deep dives • Monitor portfolio quality on an ongoing basis and recommend rating actions Qualifications • Bachelor’s degree preferably in Business Administration, Finance or Economics • At least 5 years of credit analysis experience in the financial services industry • Strong credit analysis skills and knowledge of Asia sovereign and FIs • Excellent communication skills and ability to build network with regional colleagues in London and NY as well as with business stakeholders • Curiosity to learn in a fast-paced environment and willingness to excel and go beyond expectation Salary offered will commensurate with the experience of the candidate.

Job_Title: Credit Risk – Corporate Credit, Vice President
Job_Descriptions: Morgan Stanley is a leading global financial services firm providing investment banking, securities, investment management and wealth management services. With offices in more than 43 countries, the Firm’s employees serve clients worldwide including corporations, governments, institutions and individuals. Within Morgan Stanley, Credit Risk Management (CRM) evaluates credit risk transactions, especially loans and derivatives, from all Business Units within the Firm. The department also assigns Internal Credit Ratings; establishes and manages credit risk limits in accordance with the risk tolerance established by the Board; monitors and reports on credit risk exposures on a regular basis to the Chief Risk Officer and senior management. CRM also interacts with business units to ensure that credit risk assessments are factored into business decisions. Driven by business expansion, the Asia (incl. Japan) Credit Risk Department is currently seeking a high-performing and experienced credit risk professional covering Corporates in Asia. This role is based in Singapore. Reporting to the Head of Asia Corporate Credit, the key responsibilities include: · Perform necessary credit due diligence and analysis on borrowers and trading counterparties to the Firm · Review and recommend for approval credit risk-related transactions · Approve transactions / credit limits up to level of delegated credit authority · Conduct industry research and develop sovereign and macro risk views as need to support decision making · Conduct client calls, perform independent research and establish credit rating of counterparties · Prepare loan and annual review memos for active/potential counterparties with credit limits · Review loan / derivative documentation with counterparties to ensure strong credit term protection · Monitor portfolio quality on an ongoing basis and recommend rating actions / asset classifications Requirements: · Bachelor’s degree preferably in Business Administration, Finance or Economics. MBA or CFA strongly preferred · At least 8 years of credit analysis experience in the financial services industry · Sound credit research skills and knowledge of corporates in Asia · Familiar with loan and derivative documents · Good team player with strong initiative and appetite to learn in a fast-paced environment · Mandarin skills, while not essential, will be beneficial Salary offered will commensurate with the experience of the candidate.

ABOUT US Digitalisation is more than technology. We believe digitalisation is about driving desired repeated usage through sticky core cases, supported by seamless user experience and enhanced value to deepen and extend user engagement and expand the user base. We partner leading organizations and businesses to digitalise their communities aggregating in Singapore up to 2 million users. We are also present in the Greater Bay Area, China and initiating a presence in Australia/New Zealand. Evolving from DBS FasTrack, our award winning platform in partnership with DBS, we offer our partners a proprietary user centric, vertical, counterparty, flow and payment agnostic, online-offline-online, iOT ready, self-service seamless platform, built to the same standards of scalability, resilience, stability and privacy. We deliver apps in days instead of months, for a fraction of the usual upfront costs and zero on-going, for a share of the success. The pandemic has made our services are more relevant than ever. We are building a new team to support our partners to help them thrive, transform and grow in the new normal and grow our ecosystem. JOB DESCRIPTION UX specialists have the critical job of improving the adoption and engagement of partner ecosystems. Own partner relationships and determine the best way to support them by applying our uxERP configurational tools. This role requires a candidate comfortable with market research, creative thinking as well latest ability to stay abreast of best UX practices and social engagement which serve as the backbone of a project rollout. While we are looking for User Experience Specialist, we are prepared to offer the right job for the right candidate. RESPONSIBILITIES As User Experience Specialist: Lead multiple projects and work cross functionally with product, project and development team Review, evaluate and provides tangible feedback to improve product quality and user experience to drive product innovation and experience Manage and expand strategic relationships with our partners managing their ecosystems Track partner KPIs to develop, support and execute digitization strategy SKILL SETS & TEMPERAMENT - Believe in the digital transformation, ability to communicate vision - Think out of the box for solutions on real business problems - Understand drivers of customer loyalty, previous loyalty experience will be useful - Understand and detail customer journey, some domain knowledge will be useful - Integrate technology into customer and social experience, interest in evolving technology - Has experience with digital design tools and copywriting - Work in a fast-paced, trail blazing environment - Articulate and confident to act as advisor, friend and colleague to partners - Good communication skills with colleagues and partners - Work mostly from home

Morgan Stanley is a leading global financial services firm providing investment banking, securities, investment management and wealth management services. With offices in more than 43 countries, the Firm’s employees serve clients worldwide including corporations, governments, institutions and individuals. Within Morgan Stanley, Credit Risk Management (CRM) evaluates credit risk transactions, especially loans and derivatives, from all BUs within the Firm. The department also assigns Internal Credit Ratings; establishes and manages credit risk limits in accordance with the risk tolerance established by the Board; monitors and reports on credit risk exposures on a regular basis to the Chief Risk Officer and senior management. CRM also interacts with business units to ensure that credit risk assessments are factored into business decisions. Based in Singapore, the Asia (incl Japan) Credit Risk Department is currently seeking a high-performing and hands-on credit risk professional with experience covering Corporates in Asia. This role will have these key responsibilities: • Perform necessary credit due diligence and analysis on borrowers and trading counterparties to the Firm • Review and recommend for approval credit risk-related transactions • Approve transactions / credit limits up to level of delegated credit authority • Conduct industry research and develop sovereign and macro risk views as need to support decision making • Conduct client calls, perform independent research and establish credit rating of counterparties • Prepare loan and annual review memos for active/potential counterparties with credit limits • Review loan / derivative documentation with counterparties to ensure strong credit term protection • Monitor portfolio quality on an ongoing basis and recommend rating actions / asset classifications etc. Requirements: • Bachelor’s degree preferably in Business Administration, Finance or Economics • At least 2 years of credit analysis experience in the financial services industry • Sound credit research skills • Good team player with strong initiative and appetite to learn in a fast-paced environment • Mandarin skills, while not essential, will be beneficial · Junior candidates will be considered for Analyst role Salary offered will commensurate with the experience of the candidate.

Job_Descriptions: Job Description IT INNOVATIONS for WILDLIFE! If you love to play the leading role in driving IT innovations for the Wildlife Industry, we invite you to join us at Mastermark Pte Ltd for a ‘wildly’ exciting IT career! We are driven by the excitement of building new technologies, inventing products, providing consulting advice and services that turn nature conflicts into long-term business opportunities. Our Requirements: • Degree in Computer Science, or a field related to Information Technology. • 2-5 years of experience involving some aspects of mobile app development and system design/management. • Experience with native C/C++ for backend and React for frontend development. • Basic understanding of Synology NAS or similar file management solutions. • Experience with Python, particularly for use in Raspberry Pi/Arduino, would be an advantage. • Able to initiate and manage IT processes to increase company effectiveness and efficiency. • Able to work independently and keep abreast of industry technical developments. Hiring_Company: MERRILL LYNCH GLOBAL SERVICES PTE. LTD.
Job_Title: FICC Technology: Assistant Vice President / Vice President, Python Software Engineer, FICC Macro Technology Asia, Global Markets Technology
Job_Descriptions: Your background Extensive hands-on programming skills in Python University degree, preferably in Computer Science or equivalent Excellent analytical and problem solving / investigation abilities Good interpersonal skills as a team member Proactive in tackling technical problems Willingness to pick up new skills when needed Excellent verbal / written skills Ability to balance the need for high quality output with the need to meet tight deadlines Willing to interact with global teams to drive initiatives from APAC region. Strong understanding of agile methodology, test driven development and continuous integration Nice to have Experience in financial industry (asset classes like Fixed Income or Equities) Quantitative analytical skills and working knowledge towards derivatives / financial products Understanding of economics and non-economics of the flow products traded in the market. Experience in supporting Front Office in Trade Capture, Risk and PL Awareness and experience within emerging technologies (Eg: Data technologies such as Hadoop/Kafka or similar, or Cloud technologies etc.) What you can expect Quartz is an integrated front-to-back Python-based Position Management, Pricing, Risk Management and Sales/Trading system for all financial instruments across all Global Markets business lines. The role is for a position which will contribute into the Quartz echo-system, driving evolution of the Front Office Trading experience within the key areas of Pricing, Risk/PL and Trade Capture. You will drive efficiencies by consolidating platforms and enabling low touch integrations developed on top of foundational cross product components serving all lines of businesses. You are expected to contribute into core foundational components, as well as delivering solutions to the lines of businesses leveraging these components. The successful candidate will be responsible for developing high-quality software on timescales in an intellectually challenging environment. This person is required to become proficient in the tools and processes of the team in a short space of time, and will be expected to make an ongoing contribution to improving the design, performance and auditable quality of the overall solution, as well as align the team to the strategic roadmap for Global Markets. What you will do Responsible for design and developing software in Python and associated technologies using the Quartz platform. Contribute to the architecture and design of a high-performing, multi-asset class Trade Capture/Risk/Data platforms with flexible analytics and tests simulations. Work as part of a global development team, to ensure that global tools and technologies are leveraged. Responsible for providing specific, measurable and accurate estimates on short timescales in an intellectually challenging environment Take business specific requirements and implement them in a generic and flexible manner to enable reuse. About Bank of America Our purpose as a firm is to make financial lives better, through the power of every connection. Across the world, we partner with leading corporate and institutional investors through our offices in more than 35 countries. In the U.S. alone, we serve almost all of the Fortune 500 companies and approximately 67 million consumer and small-business clients. We provide a full suite of financial products and services, from banking and investments to asset and risk management. We cover a broad range of asset classes, making us a global leader in corporate and investment banking, sales and trading. Connecting Asia Pacific to the world Our Asia Pacific team is spread across 19 cities in 12 markets. We are focused on connecting Asia to the world and the world to Asia, using our global expertise to ensure success is shared between us, our clients and our communities. Our regional footprint covers 12 currencies, more than a dozen languages and five time zones, placing us firmly among the region’s leading financial services companies.

Job_Descriptions: Job Description About the company Arte Oro is a jewellery design and manufacturing atelier that aims to provide an extraordinary personal experience of creating one’s very own pieces of bespoke jewellery by translating individual stories into the jewellery. Our involvement throughout the diamond and gem supply chain gives us the global depth and reach to satisfy the most demanding clients in the world. Danilo Giannoni, our Creative Director and Founder of ARTE ORO, started the Singapore-based company in 2017. He brought with him a rich Italian heritage in jewellery making and years of international experiences from Italy, US, Middle East and Hong Kong. Today, besides Singapore, Danilo also has a workshop in Valenza,the world’s “capital” of jewellery making, with over 40 artisans working on design and craft serving European and Middle Eastern clients. We aspire to be the first local atelier attuned to creating “Made in Singapore” custom jewellery and leave a legacy for the next generation of Singaporean. Our goal is not to own the biggest jewellery company in the world, but to have the best atelier for bespoke jewellery in the world. We want you to be part of this journey with us. About the job We are currently looking for a Client Servicing Executive to support the Director and the office of Arte Oro. The ideal person for the job will be a proactive problem solver with exceptional communication skills and a meticulous attention to detail. You will cover a wide range of responsibilities that involve clients, production, design and office operations. Work with director to understand project requirements and expectations Coordinate with local and international teams in developing projects solutions to ensure quality and cost-effectiveness Manage day-to-day operations in the local factory Delegate work to individual locally and internationally Prioritise, plan and manage project activities to ensure timely delivery Monitor project workflow and resolve any issues identified Ensure project deliverables meet quality and customer expectations Investigate problems and develop logical solutions Prepare project plans, budget and schedule present project specifications and budget breakdown to managers and director for approval Supply chain matters such as liaison with local and overseas suppliers, negotiation of pricing and delivery timelines, dissemination of instructions, ensuring that goods are delivered as per discussed timelines and in good quality Administrative work - work with Admin team to adhere to compliance standards as set by the Republic of Singapore government such as Customs standards or production standards And any other duties reasonably assigned to you and when needed Other perks High autonomy Good benefits Family-like culture Connection with high-end luxury community and network Experience in high-end jewellery making/production for international clients Required skills, experiences and qualifications Initiative-taking, ownership and organisational skill are the keys for success in this role given the nature of an SME in a niche industry in Singapore. Superb written and verbal communication skills. Strong time-management skills and the ability to organise and coordinate multiple projects at once. Proficiency in Microsoft Office and other office productivity tools, with aptitude to learn new software and systems. Flexible team player willing to do what it takes to get the job done adaptable and enjoys a challenge. Ability to keep company confidence. Fluent in both English and Mandarin (to communicate effectively with the production team). Preferred skills, experiences and qualifications Prior experience in a similar role as Personal Assistant to senior management or Office Manager. Experience in the high-end luxury industry or dealing with high-profile customers would be a value-add. Fast Apply No CV Required Fast Interview via Chat Report Job Share this job with your friends

Job_Title: Production Operators - Shift / 5 Days / Boon Lay [3770]
Job_Descriptions: WhatsApp: +65 82026403 (Anne) Email: ********@thesupremehr.com Location: BoonLay Salary: $2200 - $2600 + OT + Shift allowances (if required work shift) Working days: 5 days Working hours: 8 hours per day [Timing will be based on which department they will be placed into] Job Responsibilities: Handle raw material, weighing balances and other manufacturing equipment, including basic warehouse handling equipment such as pallet truck and electric stacker, as part of the manu-facturing activities requirement. Manufacture finished goods in accordance to specific process steps and standard operation procedures (SOP) in an efficient, precise and accurate manner. Perform to meet daily production target and capable of responding to overtime when neces-sary. Observe and practice personal hygiene and good manufacturing practices in all manufactur-ing processes. Act as an oversight for product quality on both raw materials and finished goods and identify any issues that may affect production. Ensure cosmetic and functional checks are performing on critical control points as part of food safety requirement. Perform packing and palletising of finished goods, both manually and through use of ma-chineries. Monitored and recorded process variables such as levels, flows, temperatures and pressures as required by the manufacturing process. Ensure the production inventory and all materials are well maintained in accordance to the in-ventory plan. Perform cleaning of used-equipment in accordance to SOP and perform post-cleaning checks to ensure no possibility of cross-contamination due to residual content. Perform cross-functional production activities when tasked. Practise safe and healthy working behaviour and communicate on all observed hazards and safety non-compliances. Participate as a core participant in Productivity Improvement Team and practice productivi-ty/process improvement methodologies such as 5S, COQ, Kaizen or Six Sigma. Perform additional tasked roles as part of the corporate requirements. Meet with co-workers, supervisors, engineers and managers to ensure production activity re-quirements meet corporate standards and consumer expectations. Participate as a team on fostering a culture of safety, quality and operational excellence. Jobs Requirements: Specializing in Chemical Process Technology, Engineering, Food Technology or related field Experience working with weighing balance and warehousing equipment such as pallet truck and electric stackers. Experience with HACCP, cGMP or ISO22000 systems Able to adapt and respond to changes in environment and priorities Team player Self-discipline and able to comply to SOPs and company guidelines

COMPANY DESCRIPTION Founded in 2011, Empact is a leading social enterprise with a mission to build the capacity of social organisations (referred to as non-profit organisations and social enterprises) in Singapore and the region. Our aim for our capacity building efforts is to empower these social organisations to be empowered for greater impact. Through our cross-sector collaboration with sector developers, grantmakers, corporates and volunteers, we bridge the capacity gap of the social sector by channelling talents, skills and resources to co-create innovative solutions to address the various needs of social organisations. To date, Empact has impacted and empowered more than 1,500 social organisations in the region, with a contribution of savings amounting up to $9 million worth of professional services that have been rendered pro bono for the social sector. In 2019, Empact was selected as a finalist for the President’s Challenge Social Enterprise of the Year Award. This is the highest accolade for social enterprises in Singapore by the President of Singapore. RESPONSIBILITIES An Overview We are inviting a structured, logical yet innovative, creative individual to join our fun and diverse team of consultants. You will support in leveraging Empact’s accumulated knowledge to develop programmes, trainings, tools, frameworks and thought leadership for the social sector. You will also be collaborating with team members to deliver and contribute to advisory projects through solution co-curation, project management and stakeholder engagement. This is truly an opportunity for individuals who are motivated to exercise and stretch their different skillsets and gain professional development. Roles and Responsibilities This job is for you if you are: Passionate about supporting the non-profit sector and social enterprises Keen interest in knowledge management and development of in-house assets Comfortable working both independently and in coordination with cross-functional teams Able to work on multiple projects and prioritise effectively Able to strive well in an action-oriented and agile environment User-centric, able to design with the audience in mind Strategic yet detail-oriented i.e., able to zoom-in to details and zoom-out to big picture and enjoys piecing things together Your job role will cover: Project Management: Serving as the Project Manager for assigned projects (i.e., planning, monitoring, and ensuring smooth delivery of the projects). You will support the Project Director in managing timeline and stakeholders. Lead in Innovation: Being on the node of knowledge and innovation development, translating insights into programmes, trainings, tools, framework and thought leadership that Empact could put out (e.g., via e-newsletter to our stakeholders in the social sector) Business Development & Lead Generation : Contributing to or supporting project proposal development and potential leads identification from existing projects to contribute to Business Development and healthy Sales Pipelines Internal Learning & Development: Designing and facilitating Empact’s internal learning and development sessions QUALIFICATIONS Bachelor Degree; specialisation in the Social Sciences, Education and Business-related majors will be helpful in minimising the learning curve Minimum 3 years of relevant working experience. Experience in partnership building, sector development, cross-sector collaboration, research, consulting, and/or facilitation would provide an advantage. Have familiarity of the community and social service sector (landscape, key agencies, resources, and social agencies) Possess strong analytical thinking skills, project management skills, multi-stakeholder management skills, and communication skills; familiarity with design thinking, agile project management and delivery would be a bonus. Have inquisitiveness in the unknown and new knowledge, and the ability to make sense and synthesize information accordingly. Experience in knowledge management would be a bonus. Have a creative streak, with a good eye for details and design. Proficiency in creative software is a bonus. Proficient in Excel and data analysis; able to synthesize qualitative and quantitative data, analyse data, and use the data to make informed decisions. OTHER INFORMATION WHAT’S IN IT FOR YOU? Empact offers competitive remuneration within the social sector, and comprehensive benefits that include medical and dental benefits. We have flexible work arrangements to allow you to manage both work and personal commitments. In addition, we have flexible reporting hours and 4 days of Work from Home per month for all eligible staff. We also believe in investing in our staff and their professional development through training and supervision. We offer our staff a free bespoke training that will be helpful to develop them in their respective roles. WHAT’S IT LIKE WORKING AT EMPACT? We have remarkable clients and partners, both domestically and internationally, who are working towards supporting social causes around the world We have a staff engagement programme, including regular team-building activities, fitness and volunteering sessions Our office is located in the heart of the city (CBD area) and accessible by public transport. Nearest MRT station is Tanjong Pagar with a 3-min walk to the office Located within a wide range of food choices and a place perfect for taking meetings outside, exercising and strolling Our team consists of passionate and multi-talented people of diverse backgrounds and social cause interests Together, we are inspired to bring more awareness of skill-based volunteering and enhance the capabilities of social organisations. We also adopt an open communication and collaborative workplace, making it a great venue to make an impact HOW TO JOIN OUR TEAM? If you are someone that fits the requirements, and if purpose/meaning in what you do at work important, send us your CV and a thoughtful cover letter. Your cover letter should express why you are interested in working for Empact and your qualifications. At Empact, we value diversity and inclusion and we look forward to reviewing applications from all who are qualified to apply. Please also state the following information: Current & expected salary Reason(s) for leaving Availability to commence work As part of the interview and recruitment process, candidates may be expected to demonstrate their knowledge and skills through work samples and presentations. Please note that your application will be sent to and reviewed by the direct employer - Empact

General / High-Level Scope of Work The overall management responsibility for the operational services provided to End-customer by the Company. He/she will manage, review, monitor, coordinate and report on all activities. Key Activities & Responsibilities:  Be the post sales/implementation main point of End-Customer contact, for all customer service and quality of service issues.  To maintain the accuracy of End-Customer data in systems.  Provide professional and timely monthly service reports, where required and as agreed, on all aspects of operational service including measurements against End-Customer defined SLAs.  Proactively work with the End-Customer to improve services and those procedures governing provision of these services. Arrange and attend regular End-Customer service review meetings. To provide an agenda before the meeting and to provide minutes from all meetings in accordance with the standard format. Coordinate with relevant departments to achieve fault resolution within SLA definitions.  Coordinate all planned and unplanned maintenance work to minimize disruption to the service provided to the End-Customer. Manage Change Control requirements in an operational environment in accordance with Change Control procedures. This involves: Managing End-Customer information during Change (as a Single Point of Contact) and ensuring adequate back out plans are in place. Ensuring back-out plans are implemented, if necessary. Ensuring that all End-Customer specific documentation is updated subsequent to a Change taking place. Ensuring that all financial implications of a Change are documented and implemented with the Billing department. Provide End-Customer Service Improvement Plans (SIP) as approved by the Company. Continue to contribute and enhance operational documentation and procedures to guarantee that offers the best service to its End-Customer. Fully understand the nature of the End-Customer’s business and the applications they operate over network in order to improve the performance required of the Assigned Personnel hereunder.  Manage the provision of an optimal service to the End-Customer, based on: End-Customer’s traffic forecasts and anticipation of End-Customer activity changes. Full reviews of the nominal usage values at network accesses. Strong leadership & people management skills able to develop & enhance a team with service and technical skills Experience in developing and recommending customer services solutions outside of normal product sets and assessing ability to deliver and cost implications. Summary: Celestica is looking for a people-focused and service-oriented IT leader to provide technical and business guidance to Celestica internal IT service owner and external IT partner. You will be responsible for the development of IT solutions/processes/guidance/program that creates positive customer experience during the consumption of Celestica’s IT services. This position provides direct and indirect supervision to managers and employees performing highly specialized roles, including long-term planning, objective setting, and management while providing latitude and discretion. They are accountable for initiatives or programs on a multi-national or global basis. The successful candidate will also have overall responsibility for planning, budgeting, implementing and maintaining costs, methods and employees in their specific functional area. They will regularly interact with internal executives, all levels of IT leaders and specialists and may occasionally interact with internal IT consumers. Interactions normally involve controversial situations, negotiations, or influencing and persuading other parties.
